com.jova.calculator

Class Calculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jova.calculator.Calculator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalculatorAdvanced

    public class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object

    Calculator

    Calculator class implements an interface that enables the user to calculate basic math expressions using four arithmetic operators: addition, subtraction, division and multiplication.
    Since:
    2020-12-23
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Srdjan Jovic

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.Double currentValue
      Property that holds the current value for the calculator.
      private static char[] VALID_OPERATORS
      Array of supported operators used in operator validity checking.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Calculator()
      Constructor for the Calculator class which sets the current state value to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentValue

        public java.lang.Double getCurrentValue()
        This method is used for retrieving the current calculator state value.
        Returns:
        Double Returns current calculator state value.

      • setCurrentValue

        public void setCurrentValue(java.lang.Double value)
        This method is used for setting the current calculator state value.
        Parameters:
        value - This is the new calculator state value.

      • isOperationSupported

        private boolean isOperationSupported(char operator)
        Helper method used to determine if the operator character is valid. Returns true if the VALID_OPERATORS array contains the requested operator, otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        operator - Operator which validity is checked.
        Returns:
        Boolean value true if supported, false if not.

      • isDivisionByZero

        private boolean isDivisionByZero(java.lang.Double value,
                                 char operator)
        Helper method used to determine if the requested operation is division by zero. Returs true if the operator is division, and value is zero, otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        value - Operand to be checked.
        operator - Operator to be checked.
        Returns:
        Boolean value of true if division with zero is detected, otherwise false.

      • calculate

        public void calculate(java.lang.Double value,
                      char operator)
               throws NotSupportedOperationException,
                      DivisionByZeroException
        This method is used for executing the four available arithmetic operations on the current calculator state value.
        Parameters:
        value - This is the second operand for the requested operation, where the first operand is the value of current calculator state. Can not be zero if division is requested.
        operator - This is the requested operation. Valid values for this parameter are [+, -, *, /]. Any other value will result in an exception.
        Throws:
        NotSupportedOperationException - Thrown when the provided operator is not among the supported operator list.
        DivisionByZeroException - Thrown when division by zero is detected.
